metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8633 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
drivers/firewire/net.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.7, in certain unusualhardware configurations, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia crafted fragmented packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-57.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-57.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1038.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1042-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1042.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-57.78').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1042.46').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').

linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
